Description: Ostracon, fragment of the upper-body of a red-brown pottery slightly ribbed vessel, very worn, the fabric is greyish in section, the interior is covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a brown slip and faint traces of five lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394841) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394841)
